summary: Johanna Lynn Smith was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available consist primarily of payroll certifications and related records spanning from January 1977 to December 1978. These documents detail her employment history, salary, and personal information within the HSCA. Specifically, the records include payroll authorization forms, memoranda, and certifications listing her name, position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. The documents suggest she was a staff member whose employment details were routinely documented for payroll purposes.
significance: Johanna Lynn Smith's significance lies in her role as a staff member within the HSCA. While the documents do not specify her exact duties, her presence in payroll records indicates her involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents provide a glimpse into the administrative and personnel aspects of the HSCA's work.
